sn44.7:4.1: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta went up to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna,
sn44.7:4.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn44.7:5.1: “Master Moggallāna, is this right: ‘the world is eternal’?”
sn44.7:5.2: “Vaccha, this has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn44.7:5.4: “Then is this right: ‘the world is not eternal’ …
sn44.7:5.13: ‘the soul and the body are identical’ …
sn44.7:5.16: ‘the soul and the body are different things’ …
sn44.7:5.22: ‘a Realized One doesn’t exist after death’ …
sn44.7:5.25: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’ …
sn44.7:5.28: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’?”
sn44.7:5.29: “This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn44.7:6.1: “What’s the cause, Master Moggallāna, what’s the reason why the wanderers who follow other paths answer these questions when asked?
sn44.7:6.3: And what’s the cause, what’s the reason why the ascetic Gotama doesn’t answer these questions when asked?”
sn44.7:7.1: “Vaccha, the wanderers who follow other paths regard the eye like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’ They regard the ear … nose …
sn44.7:7.3: mind like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’
sn44.7:7.4: That’s why they answer these questions when asked.
sn44.7:7.7: The Realized One, the Perfected One, the fully awakened Buddha doesn’t regard the eye like this: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self.’ He doesn’t regard the ear … nose …
sn44.7:7.9: mind like this: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn44.7:7.10: That’s why he doesn’t answer these questions when asked.
sn44.7:8.1: Then the wanderer Vacchagotta got up from his seat and went to the Buddha
sn44.7:8.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side.
sn44.7:8.4: He asked the Buddha the same questions, and received the same answers. Then he said:
sn44.7:11.2: How the meaning and the phrasing of the teacher and the disciple fit together and agree without contradiction when it comes to the chief matter!
sn44.7:11.3: Just now I went to the ascetic Mahāmoggallāna and asked him about this matter.
sn44.7:11.4: And he explained it to me with these words and phrases, just like Master Gotama.
sn44.7:11.5: It’s incredible, Master Gotama, it’s amazing!
sn44.7:11.6: How the meaning and the phrasing of the teacher and the disciple fit together and agree without contradiction when it comes to the chief matter!”
